com.wiris.quizzes.api

Interface Slot

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface Slot
extends Serializable
    This class represents a slot that will correspond to one student answer. Here we define the expected syntax of that answer, the initial content for the corresponding answer field and properties that override the question defaults. It also contains a set of AuthorAnswers, that represent criteria that can be used to grade an answer entered to the answer field corresponding to this slot. The reason why a single slot may contain multiple author answers is that the question author may want to assign partial grades if the student's answer meets less restrictive criteria, so it makes sense for a single student's answer slot to have multiple sets of criteria to be compared to.
    Since:
    4.0.0
    See Also:
    Question, AuthorAnswer

        serialize

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthorAnswers

        AuthorAnswer[] getAuthorAnswers()
        Gets the author answers for this slot.
        Returns:
        An array containing the author answer objects. It is a shallow copy of the actual array, meaning that its components are not cloned and modifying them effectively modifies their state in this slot. The array itself is new, so added author answers will not appear in it.

      • addNewAuthorAnswer

        AuthorAnswer addNewAuthorAnswer(java.lang.String value)
        Adds a new author answer to this slot.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the correct answer for the author answer being created. It can be MathML, plain text or a graphical construction.
        Returns:
        The author answer object added to this slot.

      • removeAuthorAnswer

        void removeAuthorAnswer(AuthorAnswer answer)
        Remove an author answer from this slot.
        Parameters:
        answer - An AuthorAnswer object that belongs to this slot. If it does not, this method does nothing.

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(PropertyName name,
               java.lang.String value)
        Sets the value of a property. It applies only to this particular slot, and it overrides the value of the property in the Question that contains this slot.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property.
        value - The value to be set.

      • getProperty

        java.lang.String getProperty(PropertyName name)
        Gets the value of a property for this particular slot.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property.
        Returns:
        The value of the property for this slot. If it is not set, returns the value of this property in the Question that contains this slot.

      • getSyntax

        Syntax getSyntax()
        Get the syntax assertion that will be applied to answers filled in this slot.
        Returns:
        The syntax assertion of this slot.

      • setSyntax

        Syntax setSyntax(SyntaxName type)
        Sets the syntax assertion to be applied to answers filled in this slot.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of syntax for answers filled in this slot.
        Returns:
        The syntax assertion set.

      • getInitialContent

        java.lang.String getInitialContent()
        Gets the initial content that will be present in this slot's answer field.
        Returns:
        The initial content. It can be either MathML, plain text or a graphical construction.

      • setInitialContent

        void setInitialContent(java.lang.String content)
        Sets the initial content that will be present in this slot's answer field.
        Parameters:
        content - The desired initial content. It can be either MathML, plain text or a graphical construction.

      • setAnswerFieldType

        void setAnswerFieldType(AnswerFieldType answerFieldType)
        Set the type of input field that will be used for the student answer. Choices are between an embedded editor, an editor in a popup or a plain text field. This is part of local data. It applies only to this particular slot, and it overrides the value of the property in the Question that contains this slot.
        See Also:
        AnswerFieldType

      • getAnswerFieldType

        AnswerFieldType getAnswerFieldType()
        Get the type of input field that will be used for the student answer. Choices are between an embedded math editor, an embedded graphical editor, a math editor in a popup or a plain text field. This is part of local data.
        See Also:
        AnswerFieldType
